eu.fbk.dkm.springles.base

Class BufferingTransaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.common.collect.ForwardingObject
      • eu.fbk.dkm.springles.base.ForwardingTransaction
        • eu.fbk.dkm.springles.base.BufferingTransaction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Transaction

    final class BufferingTransaction
extends ForwardingTransaction
    A Transaction decorator providing buffering capability.

    This wrapper keeps a buffer of statements. Adding statements causes the buffer to be filled; when it is full, buffered statements are 'flushed', i.e., added to the underlying transaction in a single operation, with a gain in performances. Similarly, removed statements are registered in the buffered, and 'flushed', i.e., removed from the underlying transaction once the buffer is full. Buffered statements are associated to a list of contexts (the one specified in add and remove methods). More in details, flushing occurs when:

    • there is a switch from adding to removing statements and vice-versa;
    • an add or remove operation is issued with a different list of contexts with respect to the contexts of buffered statements;
    • a read operation is issued (methods query, getContextIDs, getStatements, hasStatement and size);
    • an update operation is issued, as they may read the repository contents too (methods update);
    • an inference-related method is called (getClosureStatus, updateClosure, clearClosure);
    • when execute() is executed in read-only mode or requiring the computation of closure.
    Finally, the buffer is cleared every time reset is called, as there is no need to flush buffered statements after that operation.

    NOTE: this wrapper must not be used in auto-commit mode, as it merges together multiple add and remove operation and hence breaks the contract 'one user operation = one transaction'.

      • add

        public void add(Iterable<? extends org.openrdf.model.Statement> statements,
       org.openrdf.model.Resource... contexts)
         throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Delegates to wrapped transaction. Current buffer content is flushed if a remove / add switch or a change in contexts is detected. If the number of supplied statements is known (a Collection is supplied) then either they are totally buffered, or they are propagated together with buffered contents to the wrapped transaction if the combined size exceeds the buffer capacity. Otherwise, supplied statements are buffered one at a time and flushing occurs each time the buffer capacity is reached.
        Specified by:
        add in interface Transaction
        Overrides:
        add in class ForwardingTransaction
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException

      • remove

        public void remove(Iterable<? extends org.openrdf.model.Statement> statements,
          org.openrdf.model.Resource... contexts)
            throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Delegates to wrapped transaction. The method proceeds as described for add(Iterable, Resource...).
        Specified by:

      • execute

        public <T,E extends Exception> T execute(Transaction.Operation<T,E> operation,
                                boolean writeOperation,
                                boolean closureNeeded)
          throws E extends Exception,
                 org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Delegates to wrapped transaction. Flushes the buffer if the operation is executed in read-only mode (as it would not be possible to flush after the operation starts) or closure is needed (as closure computation may occur), then delegates.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface Transaction
        Overrides:
